page.title: 20RECREATION (ii)
page.content:
Of the quieter recreations, gardening seems to be the most popular, the emphasis being mainly on vegetables and self sufficiency.Walking is popular with retired people, there being an abundance of footpath and outstanding scenery. Many people list reading as a recreation and use the Chagford library and the mobile library from Okehampton.There are several musicians in the area, a flautist at Lower Hurston and at Batworthy Mill a guitarist and harmonica player who performs with a local band "Tickle Pink" and another young guitarist at Lingcombe. Several people play the piano, at Buda, Torr Cottage, Torr House and Beetor. Snooker is played at Beetor Farm. Wine making is also on the list of hobbies.
{COMPILED AND WRITTEN BY CHAGFORD W.I.}
